sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: After fertilization, which structure develops into the seed of a flowering plant?
Which flower structure produces pollen?
Most wind pollinated flowers have:
The offspring from asexual reproduction in plants are likely to
selectableOptions: be more resistant thant their parents to disease.
have same flower colour as their parent.
questions.wordAnswer: have same flower colour as their parent.

questions.question: Conditions essential for seed germination are:
Which of the following does not contribute to the formation of semen?
Which of the following causes labour?

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: When a sperm fertilizes an egg, the new cell formed is known as:
Which of the following is unique to seed of monocot?
The process where by fruits are formed without fertilization is known as:
The androecium of a flower is made up of:
Mammals produce less sperm and eggs than other animals because:
selectableOptions: They do not want many offspring.
There is a better chance of fertilization.
They need a lot of energy to produce more.
questions.wordAnswer: There is a better chance of fertilization.

questions.question: It determines the sex of a child:
In which part of the flower does fertilization occur?
The testa of a seed:
selectableOptions: Develops into the roots of the embryo.
Forms a protective covering around the seed.
Develops into the shoot of the embryo.
questions.wordAnswer: Forms a protective covering around the seed.

questions.question: When is the sex of a baby determined?
selectableOptions: During development of zygote into embryo.

questions.question: The role of the fertilization membrane formed after a sperm penetrates an egg is:
selectableOptions: To facilitate implantation of the zygote.
To prevent more than one sperm from entering the egg.
To attract additional sperm to the egg.
questions.wordAnswer: To prevent more than one sperm from entering the egg.

questions.question: In which part of the female reproductive system does fertilization occur?
Selective exchange of substances between the embryonic and maternal blood supplies takes place in:
The testes are in the scrotal sac outside the abdominal cavity because:
selectableOptions: The seminal fluid cannot be stored in the abdomen.
Urine will contaminate the seminal fluid.
The heat of the abdominal cavity is too high for the development of the male gametes.
The pressure of the abdominal cavity is too high for the development of the male gametes.
questions.wordAnswer: The heat of the abdominal cavity is too high for the development of the male gametes.

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: In asexual reproduction
The ovaries function in:
Asexual methods of reproduction include:
During sexual intercourse:
nonSelectableOptions: The erect penis is inserted into the vagina.
Blood flows into the spongy tissues of the penis.

questions.question: External conditions necessary for seed germination include:

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are true and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are true and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is true and the second statement is false. 
D. If the first statement is false and the second statement is true.

twoStatements: Sperm cells are produced by the testes
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: The testes is an endocrine gland.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: In epigeal germination, the cotyledons remain below the surface of the ground.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is True. Second statement is False

twoStatements: Sperm cells are the female gametes.
Sperm cell contains either X or Y chromosome
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

twoStatements: Fertilization takes place in the oviduct in mammals.
Fertilization involves the fusion of a haploid male and female gamete
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: Development of a seed into a seedling:
A type of asexual reproduction carried out by yeast:
The monthly release of an egg from the ovary:
Involuntary contraction and relaxation of smooth muscles of the uterine wall:
The period between fertilization and birth of the young:
It serves as a common passage for urine and semen in males:
Gamete producing structures in males and females:
It attaches the foetus to the placenta:
It receives pollen grains during pollination
The embryonic shoot:

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: In an experiment to investigate a factor necessary for seed germination, pyrogallic acid was placed at the bottom of one of the test tubes. Soaked bean seeds on wet cotton wool were placed above the pyrogallic acid but not touching it. A stopper was used to cork the mouth of the test tube. Which factor is being investigated for in this experiment?

In an experiment to investigate a factor necessary for seed germination, pyrogallic acid was placed at the bottom of one of the test tubes. Soaked bean seeds on wet cotton wool were placed above the pyrogallic acid but not touching it. A stopper was used to cork the mouth of the test tube. What is the role of pyrogallic acid in this experiment?
In an experiment to find out if water is necessary for seed germination, how will you set up the control experiment?
selectableOptions: Place moist bean seeds on moist cotton wool in a test tube.
Place dry bean seeds on moist cotton wool in a test tube.
Place dry bean seeds on dry cotton wool in a test tube.
Place moist bean seeds on dry cotton wool in a test tube.
questions.wordAnswer: Place dry bean seeds on dry cotton wool in a test tube.

questions.question: Seed dispersal is important to:
selectableOptions: Increase competition for light and nutrients among seedlings.
Decrease the chances of survival of the seedlings.

questions.question: Prennating organ in cocoyam:
Prennating organ in ginger
It is dispersed by wind:
It brings about ovulation:
A hormone present in blood and urine which indicates a woman is pregnant:
The amniotic fluid:
selectableOptions: Allows exchange of nutrients between foetus and mother.
Acts as shock absorber, protecting the developing foetus against mechanical injury.
Allows antibodies from mother to reach the developing foetus to provide protection against certain diseases.
questions.wordAnswer: Acts as shock absorber, protecting the developing foetus against mechanical injury.
